intro: Loasa ochagaviae, commonly known as the Andean loasa, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Loasa ochagaviae is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cooler, high-altitude environments.
